content.description: Short romp on good stone. Big holds, easy moves, lay back, top it out....if you can hike up here you can probably send this route.
content.location: Right of Too Far From the Car, starting out of a cleft in the wall.

content.description: This route contains a decent amount of climbing for its shorter height. Ride the juggy flake feature to the left eventually making your way into a flaring corner. Break out some chimney skills to gain another jug flake leading up and right to the anchors.
content.location: Start at the big flake just uphill of the large dead snag in the middle of Tiny Town.

content.description: Good little route with a mainly 5.10 approach to a 12- crux. We'll give it 11+, but be prepared for a difficult finishing sequence.
content.location: Just downhill from Sloth and No Soul. Starts up blocky stone to a high first bolt on a slab.

content.description: Harder than they look slab moves to a good crux in a featured seam.
content.location: Just right of No Soul Arete

content.description: This little bugger is harder than it looks! A stout crux near the ground guards easier climbing above.
content.protection: Camalots from .5-3, bolted anchors. Either walk off or lower off from Hoodoo Voodoo’s anchor. Or donate some lowering carabiners if you so desire :)
content.location: Second to last route on the cliff. Just around the corner from Too Far From The Car.

content.description: Follows the overhanging arête on the right side of The Ginger Pillar. Start on the right face of the the arête and make some real thin moves past the first bolt to a rest in the dihedral to the right. Clip the bolt around the corner and move left onto the cool double arête. Climb through sustained compression moves to a bouldery crux going for the anchors. Definitely top this sucker out! Stick clip the high first bolt.
content.location: The obvious overhanging arête on the right side of The Ginger Pillar in the middle of Tiny Town.

content.description: Another cool line through body sized huecos. Start up the OW crack to a stance, then move right and make some tricky moves entering the large hueco. Get it together and then climb a thin crux to the top of the feature. Top it out!
content.location: The middle line up The Ginger Pillar. Starts up the OW

content.description: Shares the OW start of Gingervitis. Climb to the third bolt then move left on slopers to two more bolts with a cool crux reach near the top. Top it out!
content.location: On the Ginger Pillar in the middle of Tiny Town. Shares the star of Gingervitis.

content.description: This novelty route may be short but it packs in some fun climbing on unique features. For full value stay true to the feature, although you can stem across to the boulder making it 11+ and slightly less fun. Stick clip the first bolt.
content.location: The very last bolted route on the cliffband. Just around the corner from Too Far From the Car.

content.description: Climb up the interesting feature to a good jug to pull over onto the slab. Move up the slab to a ledge and get ready to get cruxy. Finish with a techy and powerful boulder problem on surprisingly good rock to anchors.
content.location: The first route in Tiny Town (at the moment). Look for a pink rail feature curving to the right just behind a big pondo.

content.description: Tiny Town is home to the best warmups for the upper crags and a few decently hard lines. Don’t let the name fool you. Even though these routes are a bit short they offer great movement, stone, and typically pack a punch! There is still some route development to be had in this area for those who are interested.
